rComments: Prof. Ruiz is easily my favourite professor Ive had since starting university. He cares for his students very much. I had a complication on the midterm and he was willing to sit and discuss a fair outcome with me which most professors wont do, especially at the last minute. His lectures are very interesting to listen and participate to as well.

Absolutely loved my class with Prof. Riaz last semester. Was engaging and interesting, really listened to student's answers and integrated them into his lessons instead of looking for something narrow. Was the only class I would look forward to. Certainly not easy projects, but with a group keen on success it is more than do-able. Would take again

He's actually pretty amazing in teaching this course. You don't have to show up, as long as you can have a good understanding of his articles to compose the midterm learning report. As for grading he is honestly very generous, a minimal of B is what you will get as long as you wrote something and had some effort. Very awesome prof despite Covid
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Participation matters', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Professor Riaz is hands down one of my favourite profs. His lectures are completely discussion-based and he makes you think outside the box. The articles he gives can be a lot to read but each topic more interesting than the last. If you're into writing critical thinking reports rather than exams, 10/10 recommend IB with him.

Hands down the best prof I've ever had. No textbooks, he just gives you articles, etc. Lectures are very participation-based but he leads phenomenal class discussions the whole way through. He's very knowledgeable and contextualizes the subject matter flawlessly. Our exams were take home essays, just use some basic critical thinking skills.

Best professor I've had at Telfer. No textbook. No tests. Go to his lectures, he will teach you things that matter. He will make you look at the business world in a way you probably did not before. Do the readings. Some are tuff, but they are important.
